alert.note: Alert for Bernalillo; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 8:04PM MDT until July 29 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR FAR NORTHERN BERNALILLO AND SOUTHEAST SANDOVAL COUNTIES... At 804 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have ended over Sandia Pueblo. However, between 0.25 and 2.25 inches of rain fell between 615 PM and 715 PM. Flash flooding is expected to continue. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Far Northeast Albuquerque and the Sandia Pueblo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 234 and 241. Flash flooding is likely impacting the Evergreen Hills and Tierra Monte Subdivisions, as well as Route NF-333 northeast of Tramway Boulevard. Flash flooding is also expected in Fabo Canyon and the Sandia Wash from the west slopes of the Sandia Mountains downstream to the Rio Grande. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
